SAMPLE READING NOTES
TOPIC: how people behave in groups: deindividualization (losing individualism and self-awareness in groups) and polarization (like-minded people arriving at extreme decisions)
negative (antisocial) examples of deindividualization:
rowdiness and vandalism
fan violence
negative (antisocial) examples of polarization:
jury giving major sentence to minor criminal
town council giving jail time for littering
notes.listening-notes:
SAMPLE LISTENING NOTES
positive (prosocial) examples of deindividualization:
kind and helpful behavior after cataclysmic event
overwhelming approval for underdog winner of contest
positive (prosocial) examples of polarization:
townspeople getting rid of town bully
employees banding together to deal with horrible boss
